content:
In making a beta release for Bee, I get a 'packaging error' text file added to the release on GitHub. In it, it says:

The project node could not be created on BackdropCMS.org because no .info file was found in the repository.

Is there a way to avoid this? I don't need an info file, because this isn't a module/theme/layout, and I don't want to give the impression that it can be installed like other projects by adding an info file. But at the same time I don't like the 'packaging error' text file added to the release... FYI, Drush has this same problem.

https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/bee/releases/tag/1.x-1.0.0-beta

Release 1.x-1.0.0-beta · backdrop-contrib/bee
Beta release for 1.0.0
I see that I can edit the release and remove the text file. Is that the best solution?

Same issue with https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/backdrop-drush-extension/releases @BWPanda ...you can either ignore, or remove the release asset. ...or was your intention to allow creating a release node on b.org for some reason?

Releases · backdrop-contrib/backdrop-drush-extension
A set of commands and boot class for Drush and Backdrop CMS. - backdrop-contrib/backdrop-drush-extension
...perhaps we should allow type = utility or something like that in .info files. Drupal has done the same. See Add a “General” project type to Drupal.org
:+1: :smile:
Though it would be nice to have downloads available on B.org. just not from the project installer...
I'm thinking that such projects need a project node, but perhaps no release nodes ...if that's possible :thinking:
